#Text=Portland man arrested for murder , intimidation in MAX train hate speech incident
#Text=Monday , May 29 , 2017

#Text=Saturday morning , 35-year-old Portland , Oregon man Jeremy Christian was arrested and taken to the Multnomah County Detention Center on charges including murder , attempted murder and intimidation after verbally harassing two young women on a train and then attacking three men with a knife .
#Text=At least two of the victims attempted to intervene with the suspect and calm him down .
#Text=The suspect attacked the men , stabbing three , before leaving the train .
#Text=— Portland Police Bureau

#Text=An official statement from the Portland Police Bureau said Christian " was on the MAX train yelling various remarks that would be best characterized as hate speech toward a variety of ethnicities and religions .

#Text= Without them , we probably would be dead right now . "

column1: #Text=The two men who died were Ricky John Best , age 53 , and Taliesin Myddrin Namkai-Meche , 23 .
#Text=The third knife victim , Micah David-Cole Fletcher , 21 , was still hospitalized as of today .
#Text=Best , who served 23 years in the U.S. Army , left behind four children .
#Text=Namkai-Meche graduated from Reed College with a degree in economics and was working as an intern .
#Text=Fletcher , who has disclosed publicly he is on the autism spectrum , was profiled by Venture in 2015 for his participation in a Portland poetry slam .
#Text=At that time , Fletcher disclosed he had been institutionalized for " erratic anger " during middle school .
#Text=Christian has come to the attention of police before .
#Text=He was convicted of robbery and kidnapping in 2002 .
#Text=On April 29 , he showed up to a right-wing free speech march armed with a baseball bat and threatened counter-protesters .
#Text=He was wearing a U.S. flag like a cape , shouting racial epithets and making the Nazi salute .
#Text=The police took away his bat .
#Text=He attended a number of alt-right rallies and , according to the Southern Poverty Law Center , Christian has promoted white supremacist views on the Internet .
#Text=The attack took place the day before the beginning of the Muslim holy season , Ramadan .
#Text=The Council on American-Islamic Relations has asked U.S. President Donald Trump to condemn the killings .
